free_text.Content: [b]Propagation of the variance[/b][br/]Error types - correlated observations[br/]Covariances, cofactors and weights[br/]Propagation of maximum and mean errors[br/][b]Conditional Adjustment[/b][br/]Functional and stochastic models[br/]Principle of least squares[br/]Analysis of the results[br/][b]Parametric Adjustment[/b][br/]Functional model - Linearization and iterations - Results assessment - Link with the linear regression - Selection of suitable models[br/][b]Combined problems[/b][br/]Alternatives - constraints - combined case[br/][b]Applications[/b][br/]Experiments in physics, chemistry and biology[br/]Tunnel boring
free_text.Keywords: Error propagation, adjustment calculus, least squares
free_text.Type of teaching: Alternating lectures and interactive exercices, computer lab, office hour [br/]
free_text.Learning outcomes: At the end of the course, the students are able:[br/]-	to treat numerical problems in a rigourous manner, with emphasis on independent controls[br/]- to understand the main methods for the adjustment of observations and for the estimation of parameters;[br/]-	to apply certain models to specific problems pertaining to various experimental sciences, in particular in the environmental domain;[br/]-	to deliver results with a realistic estimation of their precision[br/]
